page.title: 09NANPANTAN RESERVOIR
page.content:
Built in 1870,it is 6.65m deep and holds 6000 megalitres.
{Water Treatment Works {} In the pressure filter house there are fourteen rapid pressure filters which contains fine sand,coarse sand,gravel, stones. The water goes through the rapid pressure filters and the large bits are taken out. The water goes to the sludge tank where it stays for a while and some bits sink. The water goes to the slow sand filters. The slow sand filters take the small bits out. Then the chlorine is added _ 0.6 parts per million. The water is now fit to drink.
